channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report E-2023090134
item.description:
Report E-2023090134

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: MENOMONEE FALLS
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: As a straight truck was being offloaded at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility, it was discovered that a wrangler was leaking. The wrangler was placed on oil dry and the spill was cleaned up. An investigation of the incident revealed that inner packagings were incorrectly loaded into the wrangler container which punctured the inner liner.

item.title: Report E-2023090132
item.description:
Report E-2023090132

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: MENOMONEE FALLS
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: In the process of offloading a trailer at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Menomonee Falls, WI, an employee he clipped a 301H2 with the forklift which resulted in the container being punctured. Approximately 1 liter of waste spilled into the trailer. The spill was cleaned up and the container was overpacked.

item.title: Report I-2023080014
item.description:
Report I-2023080014

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T15:12:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-05
  • City: Viola
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: N&M TRANSFER
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. Upon arrival at the consignee, and odor was detected in the trailer. The consignee refused the shipment and the trailer doors were closed. REI Engineering(REI) was dispatched to complete the cleanup. REI arrived and inspected the shipment. REI discovered a release of approximately 0,5 gallon of product due to a loose cap. REI tightened the loose cap and overpacked the Ieaking drum as a precation. The freight was left on the trailer. N&M Transfer returned the shipment to the shipper.
